Recology

An exploration of using R for ecology, evolution, and open science.

rOpenSci - Tools to facilitate open science in the R environment.

  • rplos is now up on CRAN

See my GITHUB page (here) for code repositories and code snippets in the gists (here2).

  • Code for simulating mutualistic networks. Link to Jeff Kilpatrick’s website here3.
  • Meta-analysis database (used in Chamberlain & Holland 2009 Ecology). Download the database by going to Ecological Archives.
  • Code for running Phylometa in R. Download the two files needed: phylometa_fxn.R and phylometa_inR_run.R. See my blog for an explanation and example of this code. Get Phylometa at Marc’s website.
  • Code for running Phylometa in R, but only comparing observed phylogenetic MA to a shuffle tip traditional MA: phylogmeta_rand_fxn_one.R. Tree file. “ Data file. See my blog post about usage.
  • Code for adjusting branch lengths: bladjing_twomethods.R, example of use at [my blog][], tree file, and node ages file.
  • State abbreviations and full names
  • USDA farmers markets: (excel format, can’t upload csv files)

About

Recology is a blog that explores using R for ecology, evolution, and open science. See more.

The Author

My name is Scott Chamberlain. I am a graduate student in ecology and evolution at Rice University, in the EEB department.
